characters: PROPERTY OF THE MANHATTAN DISTRICT ATTORNEY
19C AND THIS TIME LIGHTNING SIZZLES THROUGH THE SKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Northern Florida in the midst of a heat wave. Air conditioners fighting a losing battle. The gallery is full. The JUDGE a stern, old hand. The PROSECUTOR, an efficient man with a good case. The witness is BARBARA. She is maybe 13. She is a witness in a criminal trial. Her testimony has been carefully rehearsed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... we go back to our homeroom for dismissal, unless you have a pass for sports or something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And is that what you did on the day in question?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Mr. Gettys asked me to stay after class.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened next, Barbara?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Gettys closed the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone else had gone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. He told me to sit in the chair beside his desk. MR. GETTYS, the defendant, is 50. The very picture of respectability. His perfect wife and son staunchly enduring this testimony.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In your own words, Barbara, can you tell us exactly what happened during the next few minutes? KEVIN LOMAX.    Defense counsel.   Taking it all in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told him I was afraid I would miss my bus. He promised I would get to the bus on time if I would help him to do something... Kevin -- his eyes -- drifting around the courtroom -- taking inventory -- assessing damage --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Then he put -- before I could say anything -- he placed his hand inside my blouse... Kevin -- checking the jury and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... I was so frightened I didn't move. I thought if I was just quiet it would be okay... Kevin -- checking Gettys -- seeing something that stops him cold --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Then his other hand went up under -- inside my skirt... Gettys' hand -- down below the table -- down where no one but Kevin could possibly see it -- Getty's fingers subtly feeling their way along the leg of his chair --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... his hand then, it started, he started, moving back and forth -- farther and farther inside my skirt... Kevin -- glancing around -- nobody else can see it --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... he said he was testing to see if I had any special feelings, that he wanted to find out what kind of feelings I had...

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Gettys' hand -- excited now -- stroking the chair leg -- absently -- involuntarily -- unmistakably sexual --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... I didn't know what to say, I was trying to think of something to say but I was confused and he just kept on -- with his hand -- moving it -- under my dress -- higher and higher... Kevin is rocked.    Trying not to show it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... then I, I was asking him to stop but it was like he couldn't hear me -- he just kept on -- Suddenly, Gettys' hand stops moving --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- and then I screamed... Kevin looks up to find Gettys' eyes waiting for him. Gettys quickly returns his hand into his lap. He's been caught -- watching, as Kevin turns away and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... then he, he got mad and said we would have to try again sometime.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And did he try again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With friends of yours?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And when you told them what he had done to you, they told you what he had done to them, isn't that true?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have nothing further.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (finding Kevin)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your witness, Mr. Lomax.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any chance, Your Honor, for a short recess?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kevin heading quickly away from the courtroom.     Gettys right on his heels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lloyd, as your attorney, I'm advising you to get the fuck away from me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?   What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wife. The kid. The outrage. You definitely had me fooled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're my lawyer! You're here to defend me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what I'm thinking? Why don't we put you on the stand and you can jerk off for the judge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know she's lying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get the hell out of my way. Gettys standing aside, as we --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An ancient upstairs facility. Kevin standing at the mirror. Frozen there. Identity crisis. Morality crisis. He takes off his wedding ring. Letting cold water run in the sink. His eyes never leaving the mirror.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Behind him, the door opens.     A local REPORTER enters, moves to the urinal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, hell, there you are. Rumor was you were out wandering in traffic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not now, Larry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the game plan, Kevin? I got a four-thirty deadline. I need a quote. Gimme a quote.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Mr. Lomax had no comment on today's events. Speculation, however, was widespread that the young lawyer's unblemished string of victories would come to an end in this courtroom.' Kevin pulls some cold water to his face. Startled, as THUNDER EXPLODES overhead -- then just as suddenly, becomes nothing more than the urinal flushing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was a nice run, Kev. Had to close out someday. Nobody wins 'em all. The Reporter exits.      Kevin alone with the mirror. And then it's over. He's made his decision. Replacing his wedding ring. Reaching for his jacket, as we --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kevin walking through. His game face.      A court office opening the doors and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DEVIL'S ADVOCATE - Rev. 11/2/96                        6.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barbara on the stand.   Everyone in place. KEVIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Math hasn't exactly been your subject this year, has it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. KEVIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any theories on why you've done so poorly in math this year? BARBARA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not my fault. KEVIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you say Mr. Gettys is the problem? (as she shrugs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not sure. Have you had any discipline problems in math class this year?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. KEVIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No? Isn't it true Mr. Gettys has had to talk to you repeatedly about your behavior? Isn't that why he asked you to stay after class?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. KEVIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have other teachers ever asked you to stay after class?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Once or twice. KEVIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did they want to talk about your behavior?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Objection.    Immaterial. KEVIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goes to motive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DEVIL'S ADVOCATE - Rev. 11/15/96

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Overruled.    You may answer the question.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what the other teachers wanted. You'd have to talk to them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ever pass notes in class, Barbara? Maybe a note that made fun of Mr. Gettys?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No? Never called him a 'disgusting pig monster'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Kevin handing out paperwork.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your Honor, I've pre-marked this Defense Exhibit A...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Objection, Your Honor, we've had plenty of time for discovery here. The Judge quickly studying his copy of the note.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna let this in, Mr. Lomax, I'm also gonna suggest that if you have any other exhibits you present in a timely fashion or not at all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (right to the note)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Barbara, I was wrong, it's 'huge hog beast'. This is your handwriting, isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, but --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DEVIL'S ADVOCATE - Rev. 11/15/96

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wrote this in his class.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a joke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'He's a huge hog beast. He probably eats a thousand pancakes for breakfast.' You're writing here about Mr. Gettys, aren't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was meant to be a joke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you ever had a party at your house when your parents were away? (waiting)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes or no?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Objection.   This is way out of...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Credibility and bias.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Overruled.   Answer the question.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (rattled)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The word special came up in your testimony earlier. You claimed that Mr. Gettys asked you whether you had special feelings, if you felt special. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you ever heard of a game called 'Special Places?' (waiting)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're under oath, Barbara. A man's career -- his reputation -- his life is on the line. This is not a joke. Have you ever played the game Special Places?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DEVIL'S ADVOCATE - Rev. 11/15/96

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this game sexual in nature? (waiting)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this game sexual in nature?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We only played it once.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This special party, Barbara, this was the first time you told the story about Mr. Gettys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've spoken to the other children who were there that day. Can you think of anything else, Barbara, they might have told me about that party?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Objection. Your Honor, if he has other witnesses let him call them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (right at Barbara)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I need to call those other children, I will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna sustain that, Mr. Lomax. Rephrase your question.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You threatened those children, didn't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not the way it happened --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You told them to falsely claim that Mr. Gettys had hurt them, didn't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These things did happen!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DEVIL'S ADVOCATE - Rev. 11/15/96

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because if they didn't go along you were going to tell everyone about this special party.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They happened to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you made up a story. A special story, about a math teacher -- a disgusting pig monster -- you didn't like. That's what really happened, isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't want to be the only one! BARBARA'S FATHER can take it no longer -- suddenly on his feet -- charging --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You son of a bitch! The bailiff making a diving grab --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have no further questions, Your Honor. Chaos -- court officers struggling with Barbara's Father and people yelling and Gettys hugging his wife and son and the gavel banging like mad and Kevin just sitting there, staring at the floor, completely drained, emotionally, morally, physically and -- In the back of the room, a man. He's black. Elegant. Amused by the scene. His name is LEAMON HEATH. MARY ANN LOMAX leans in behind her husband.      She is a doll. We love her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pack it up, baby. You need a drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a rock and roll joint. Florida style. But it's early and empty. Kevin at the bar with Mary Ann, two LAWYER friends, the Reporter and someone's girl friend. 12 shot glasses, two rows of six. A perfect tequila pour and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the event we all get drunk and forget, I suggest we frontload the ceremonial bullshit... (a toast)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To the best damn trial lawyer in Alachua County. Kevin, subdued, watches the rest of them drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, Kev, off the record, how's it feel to squeeze a man like Gettys through the door of reasonable doubt?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. (waving him off)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you already, we're not gonna discuss that damn case anymore. Done. (to Kevin)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Am I right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll drink to that. (as he does)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No shop talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tequila pours.      As the night goes on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drunk frat boys laughing as they exit. A BAR BAND in the distance. Kevin done pissing. Moving for the sink, when he suddenly stops. Freezes. A mirror above the sink. There he is. The guy that set Gettys free.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Lomax? Kevin turns -- Leamon Heath standing beside him. HEATH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helluva job today. (quickly presenting his card)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't want to disturb your party. KEVIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Milton, Chadwick, Waters. Never heard of it. (looking up)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you gonna do? Sue me? HEATH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, we were hoping to retain your services. We've been following your progress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From New York. HEATH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've never lost a case. KEVIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've had some sympathetic juries. HEATH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's exactly what we're looking for. We want you to come to New York. Help us pick a jury.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really. (amused now)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll tell you, man. You're pretty damn good. And the card is great. And the black thing -- you being black -- whose idea was that? Paul's? 'Cause that's just brilliant. (as he's walking)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just not drunk enough yet to fall for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'd have to start next week. (waiting as Kevin stops there) All expenses. First class travel and lodging. You and your wife. A lump sum payment, regardless of verdict in the amount of, well... (in his hand) Here. Take a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kevin takes the check.    Still looking at it, as we --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two dozen cars parked.    MUSIC and SINGING from inside. sign reads: "SEMINOLE CALVARY CHURCH OF THE REDEEMER"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside the church. Plain and functional. Poor but faithful. A trio -- electric guitar, accordion, tambourine -- playing a hymn. Forty-five voices raised in song. The tempo is ragged and the pitch shaky, but the feeling is strong. They mean it. The CAMERA FINDS -- MRS. LOMAX. Kevin's mother. Forty- si Singing her heart out. A woman with faith, in the presence of her Lord. The CAMERA FINDS -- Kevin. In the very back. Standing in the doorway. Halfway in. Halfway out. Shadow. Light. Waiting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Post-service.    Mrs. Lomax and Kevin walking to her car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's two weeks at most.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've never been to New York.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Every dog gets a day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pick a jury... (ridiculous) I feel the hand of Mary Ann on this adventure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: New York is not a good idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, how you fixed for cash?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have my bad feeling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (an envelope) I put a couple hundred in here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds like more than two weeks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary Ann typed out the numbers for you -- phone, the flights -- it's all in there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me tell you about New York.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with a smile) Babylon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forewarned is forearmed. (half-serious) 'Fallen, fallen is Babylon the great. It has become a dwelling place of demons.' Revelation Eighteen. Wouldn't hurt you to look it over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (rolls with it) Couldn't forget it if I tried.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what happened to Babylon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Thou mighty city. In one hour hast thou mighty judgement come.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'And the light of a single lamp shall shine in thee no more.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kevin gathers her in.         Kissing her good-bye, as we

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darkness. Where are we? A door opens in another room -- VOICES -- KEVIN and MARY ANN. They're LAUGHING. Coming in from a big night out. For an instant -- light -- we glimpse a great hotel suite -- and then --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- wait -- leave 'em off --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- what are you... I can't --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- close your eyes -- do it --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More LAUGHTER.       Stumbling shadows moving PAST us and

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.    Stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kevin behind Mary Ann with his hands over her eyes. takes his hands away, but her eyes stay closed...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.    Open your eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as she does) Wow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The view.    Wham.    The definitive New York skyline.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Go ahead...' (in her ear)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: '... bite the Big Apple.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (she's dancing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: '... Rats on the West Side, bed bugs uptown, I can't give it away on Seventh Avenue. This town don't look good in tatters...'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know... looks to me like that dress is in your way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shocked, stops)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why, counselor... (her best drawl)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Surely you don't think a small- town girl changes overnight just because a man buys her dinner in the big city.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, ma'am. In fact, I hardly ever think at all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, that's different, then. You're my kind of guy. Kevin smiles.   She's taking off the dress.   Babylon.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: Six huge courthouses.   All those courtrooms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Criminal court. Voire dire. Potential jurors fill the benches. A bored judge. MEISEL, defense counsel, is a sour, New York veteran. The juror being questioned, a PIE-FACED MAN with bad vision.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DEVIL'S ADVOCATE - Rev. 11/15/96

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you think as a juror you'd be able to set aside any prior opinions you might hold about the savings and loan industry? (long pause) That was a question, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?   Do I like bankers?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heath catches Meisel's eye.     Waves him over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your Honor, may I have a minute to speak with my colleagues.

dialogues.speaker: DEFENSE TABLE
dialogues.text: Kevin and Heath. And the defendant -- a well-tailored reptilian banker. Meisel joins them. Sotto voce.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dump him. While you're at it let's get rid of number six, eight, and I'd say lose number twelve, except the prosecutor's gonna fuck up and do it for us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Number six? You're kidding, right? She's my first choice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's my first pass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And eight? With the dreadlocks? That's crazy. He's a defendant juror if I ever saw one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see his shoes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, kid, maybe down in Florida you're the next big thing, but this is New York. Manhattan. We're not squeezing oranges here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He polishes those shoes every night. He makes his own clothes. He may look like a brother-with- an-attitude to you, but I see a man who's got a shotgun under his bed and woe betide the creature who steps into his garden. (beat) And number six? Your favorite? She's damaged goods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's a Catholic schoolteacher. (to Heath) She believes in human frailty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. There's something missing from her. She's wrong. (eyes to the pool) She wants on this jury. Somebody hurt her and she wants revenge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How the hell do you know that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (honestly) I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Heath) Look, either you put a stop to this happy horseshit or I walk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a pause) All right. Here's the deal. (to Kevin) I lose with your jury? You do the explaining.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The defendant staring a hole into Kevin, as we --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kevin leaving court.    In no hurry to get home.    He li it here.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Across the street, a man, one of many passing on the sidewalk. Except this man turns as Kevin passes. Watching him. Seeing something that pleases him. This is JOHN MILTON. And now, as Kevin disappears, Milton joins the flow of people heading down into a subway station -- down -- and gone, as we PULL BACK TO --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As day becomes night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary Ann watching TV alone. Remnants of a room service dinner. They've been living here for weeks now. The maids have started to give up. Kevin enters looking beat.    Grabs a cold french fry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into her show) Your mother called. She has her bad feeling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Every now and then she gets one right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's up? (looks over) You okay? Something's up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They deliberated for thirty-eight minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh shit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DEVIL'S ADVOCATE - Rev. 11/2/96

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turns off the TV, comforting him) Oh, Kevin... I'm sorry, honey. What the hell did they expect? The man is guilty as can be. Wasn't a jury anywhere gonna let him off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.   Except one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kev....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a big ole smile) Not fucking guilty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Omigod...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thirty-eight minutes.     My jury.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did it!   Omigod, Kevin...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put on something that's gonna be easy to take off later. We are going out, girl!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Milton, Chadwick, Waters. Those words written in stone on the wall. The decor is stark, dramatic, awesome. The receptionist is simply stunning. Kevin, wearing his best suit, walking with Heath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry to keep you waiting, but Mr. Milton got pinned down in Indonesia a little longer than expected. (quietly as they hit the view) Not bad, huh? You can play it cool if you want, but the first time I walked in here, my jaw was on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The firm offices.      A large central atrium.    Offices this space.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Lawyers come in all shapes and sizes. Assistants -- male and female -- are uniformly attractive. The HUM of serious BUSINESS in the background.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as they walk) We've got forty partners vested at the moment. Close to six hundred associates. This is the home office, but we've got quite a few international arrangements, so Mr. Milton spends a good deal of his time in the air. In addition to our corporate clients, we're currently representing about twenty-five foreign countries. Mid-East, Balkans, Central America, West Africa. Interesting work, but travel intensive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kevin slowing as they pass an open doorway --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's got you scheduled for fifteen minutes, which is a good sign, so make the most of it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THROUGH a large window we see a woman pacing her office. She's wearing a headset and arguing in machine-gun Italian. She is a goddess. Her name is CHRISTABELLA. She is beautiful beyond propriety. She will also turn out to be a brilliant EUC lawyer. She turns. Sees us staring -- like that -- Venetian blinds close tightly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heath is now far ahead.    Kevin rushing to catch up --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kevin about six steps into it when suddenly, he looks down. Stops. Completely spooked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gotcha. (smiles) Man, I just love that...

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The floor is nothing but glass. Sixty stories above the world. A bridge between two skyscrapers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I watched a Senator piss his pants right where you're standing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nonplussed) Great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's waiting for you.      Good luck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kevin sucks it up.      Starts walking.    Up ahead, noth but an open door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First of all it's round. And large. The walls are made of stone. No windows. There are dramatic shafts of natural light from above. Stark and clean to the extreme. No paper anywhere. Kevin standing there.      Taking in the space.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kevin turns.       There he is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry.    Didn't mean to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  Please. (his hand) Kevin Lomax.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (they shake) John Milton.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice to meet you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have we been treating you well?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very well.    Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your wife, she's had a good time?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sure has. It's been great. The whole thing's been great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. That's our secret. We kill you with kindness. (walking the room, circling) What's your secret?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I couldn't say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were a prosecutor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out of law school. Five years in the Jacksonville D.A.'s office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sixty-four straight convictions. What a number.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like to be in court.   I didn't plea out a lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that like? One day you're putting them away and the next you're setting them free?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Takes a little getting used to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pays better though, doesn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes it does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The math teacher. The Gettys case. I hear you were brilliant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Prosecutor dropped the ball.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DEVIL'S ADVOCATE - Rev. 11/2/96

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really.   So you think your guy was guilty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't say that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's this? I began the case with a clear conscience.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quiet a moment) I was sure you had a secret.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men's room. (beat) Upstairs men's room in the Duval County courthouse. There's a hole in the wall. Straight through to the next room. (smiles) I spent five years listening to juries deliberate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Love it all you want, just don't repeat it. I'm not sure the Florida Bar Association would appreciate it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't really want to go back to Florida, do you? Walk with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With that, Milton pushes a button.     Huge panel screens open out to:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A reflecting pool. Water right to the edge. A narrow walkway straight through the middle. And we're fifty stories above the city. The effect is staggering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DEVIL'S ADVOCATE - Rev. 11/15/96

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think? Some people can't handle it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's peaceful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly. (pleased) Fill in the resume. Tell me about your family. What does your father do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never got to know my father. He passed away before I was born. My mom raised me. Just the two of us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She never remarried?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She wasn't married the first time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That can't be easy in Gainesville.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think it's easy anywhere. (re the view) Holy shit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Little different when you're looking down, isn't it? (beat) Tell me about her. Your mother. What's she like?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's a preacher's daughter. She's tough. She's worked in the same poultry plant for as long as I can remember. I think she's up to eight-fifty an hour. She's got a church she really likes, so she's usually either there or they go out, they do a lot of volunteer work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DEVIL'S ADVOCATE - Rev. 11/15/96

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Many are in high places, and of great renown: but mysteries are revealed unto the meek.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So they say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't rub off on you?    The book? The church?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm on parole.     Early release for time served.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly they're quiet.       Silenced by the view.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lotta potential clients down there. (Sooner or later it all flows through the streets.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have to sell me on New York.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You like it here, don't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are we negotiating?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Always.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do you need a criminal department?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because our clients break the law just like everyone else and I'm tired of sending their business across the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you offering me a job?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm thinking about it. You have the talent. I knew that before you got here. It's the other thing I wonder about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DEVIL'S ADVOCATE - Rev. 11/15/96

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What thing is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pressure. Changes everything. Some people, you squeeze them, they focus. Some people fold. Can you summon your talent at will? Can you deliver on deadline? Can you sleep at night?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When do we talk about money?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Money's the easy part.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carnegie Hall. High off Central Park.       A Mercedes stretch pulls to the curb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mt. Sinai Hospital right up the street. Some excellent schools.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The driver rushing to open the door. Heath, Kevin and Mary Ann getting out of the car just as a group of uniformed school children come charging out of the building to meet their bus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I doubt it was at the top of his list when Mr. Milton bought the building, but it's a great neighborhood for children.

dialogues.speaker: LOOKING UP
dialogues.text: A stately, pre-war apartment house. One unique touch; the penthouse rises in a sort of wedding cake design.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turn of the Century. Elegant. Two apartments per floor. JACKIE HEATH waiting here. She is black, early thirties, and very, very attractive. The elevator doors open.     Mary Ann steps out, followed Kevin and Heath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must be Mary Ann -- Welcome. I'm Jackie Heath...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's so sweet of you to come by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please.   We live across the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're kidding?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So it's just two apartments per floor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to her husband) You didn't tell them about the apartment?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought I'd let it speak for itself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Opening the door, and we enter --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A dream. Twelve-foot ceilings. Huge, oversized rooms. Crown moldings. A huge central hallway. And light. Kevin and Mary Ann walking through. Blown away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's what they call a classic eight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We had them paint everything white. Let you see it naked before you pick your palette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What am I picking?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Palette.   Your colors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to warn you about one thing. (as they turn back) There are going to be some very envious people at the firm. These apartments, there aren't many of them, it's really a partner's perk. You must've made quite an impression.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Took us six years to get in here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: French doors opening. Kevin walks out. Mary Ann just behind him. They stand there, staring at the park.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you really this good?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DEVIL'S ADVOCATE - Rev. 11/2/96

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I sure as hell hope so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They must want you pretty bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, Mare, I'm only getting behind this if you're on board. You want to go home, I'm with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. Let's go back to Gainesville. You can keep scrounging for clients and pumping out the basement and I'll keep repossessing cars for Akamian. Maybe, if we kill ourselves, in about five years we can afford a baby and a weekend shack at Gulf Shores. (beat) Are you shitting me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She smiles first.      Kevin pulling her toward him, as w

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Incredible and extreme. Forty people -- SENIOR PARTNERS and department heads -- seated at the table. They've been going around the table introducing themselves to Kevin. Nearing the end now --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Krasna.   Maritime Law.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parvathi Resh. Energy law.     I run the Islamic sub-group.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joyce Rensaleer. Mergers and acquisitions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chan Sanyou.   Intellectual property.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie Barzoon.     Managing Director.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christabella and another woman running in.       Taking s quickly. Christabella beside Kevin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DEVIL'S ADVOCATE - Rev. 11/2/96

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christabella Adrioli. Economics. Primarily G-7 and E.C.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There you go, Kevin. The whole team. I'm trying to think how long it's been since we were all together. All of us. Too long. I'm looking around, I know some of you came from very far away to be with us here today. It's appreciated. (pacing the window) This room we're in was built -- architecturally designed -- to promote healthy group dynamics. A psychic centrifuge. Makes you want to reach out, doesn't it? Inclusion. Commonality. Synergy. All that good shit. That's what I'm looking for today. Because when I hear stories -- the kind of stories I've been hearing -- about backbiting, about partners not working together, departments cutting each other's throats over clients, or worse... I feel drained. It drains me. I feel empty. I feel as though I've let you all down. (off dead silence) We need something. A gesture. (across the table) What do I need, Eddie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about a public flogging?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a minute. I got it. It's perfect. It's intimate. It's quick. Doesn't cost a thing. There's a power to it. What is it? (beat) Let's hold hands. All of us. Together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Milton is first.    Reluctance begins to fold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DEVIL'S ADVOCATE - Rev. 11/2/96

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right now. Every person at this table -- take the hand of the person on either side...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kevin finds Christabella's hand at his side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want out of this, Eddie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've made your point, John.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You won't hold hands? (stare-down) It's important to me, Eddie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kevin watching Barzoon fold.       Watching the circle fo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See.   See, I feel better already.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very nice. Major windows. Stripped down at the moment, but there's a desk and phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (kidding) I guess it'll do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Until something better comes along...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the doorway, PAM GARRETY.       Never married.   Two-p day habit. Tough as dirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kevin Lomax.   Pam Garrety.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as they shake) Pam was with the Brooklyn D.A.'s office for fourteen years, so she knows her way around the local scene. She'll be your guide. (to Pam) You're gonna be expediting his New York Bar application, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the pipeline. For now, we'll just have you work pro hac vice. We've petitioned Florida for a letter of good conduct. And... (a folder) ... I prepared, at Mr. Milton's request, an overview of the Moyez case.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Moyez case?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deep ghetto side street. One of those blocks that have been completely lost. One whole side of the street has nothing but boarded-up row houses. A black Town Car pulling through.    Slowing now --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kevin and his DRIVER peering across the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta stick with the vehicle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A storefront botanica. Insane colors. Rusted iron grates covering two tiny cataract windows. A steel door is open. There's a sick-looking DOG tied to the doorknob; he begins BARKING wildly, as he sees -- Kevin walking from the car.    Suit and tie.     Briefcas Turning, as he hears --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DEVIL'S ADVOCATE - Rev. 11/2/96

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You get 'em!   Go get 'em, man!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three JUNKIES camped on the stoop of a burned-out brownstone across the street. Dull, wasted faces aroused by the DOG'S BARKING --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell her turn that shit down! I know what she's doin'! That's right! Tell 'em take that noise back t'Africa 'fore I --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stopping instantly because -- a WOMAN is standing in the botanica doorway. Her skin is jet black. Her eyes are pale blue. Her hair is white. She holds a live chicken by its feet. The DOG is still BARKING so she slaps it. Hard. Now there is silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm looking for Phillipe Moyez.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She moves aside.    Kevin enters --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's dark. Oil lamps and candles for light. The air thick with incense. Jars and bags and boxes are stacked on shelves everywhere. Powders. Oils. Bones. Skins. Potions. Dried herbs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I called this morning, I'm not sure who I spoke with. (awkward silence) I'm his lawyer. I have a card... (finding it) They said he would meet me here. Phillipe Moyez.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into the back) Bhalla! Bhalla!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kevin taking a very deep breath, as we --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darkness. A door opening above us. A BOY -- maybe ten -- standing there. Kevin behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I'm not sure I'm making myself clear here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moyez. (a French accent) You need him. Speak wid him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Boy hits the lights. A naked bulb on the landing below. Beyond that, darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're saying he's down here? (incredulous) In the basement? In the dark?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughing) Where? Where you think -- ? Where you think me taking you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Boy, still laughing, starts down the stairs -- into the darkness. Kevin hesitates. Sucks it up. Crouching not to hit his head as he goes down into --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Around the landing -- the Boy still in front of him and -- down -- as another light comes up and the boy moves quickly through the space, turning on lamps here and there. No furniture. Mounds of bones. The walls painted a deep, black red.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kevin waiting as the last light goes on --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought I would recognize you, but I do not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kevin, spooked, wheels around --

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: PHILLIPE MOYEZ squatting in the corner. Skinny and intense. His eyes opaque and piercing at the same time. At once unassuming and terrifying. A plastic bag of fresh green roots in his lap. Ghat. Miraa. African cocaine. His teeth black from chewing it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Moyez? (as he nods) We've never met. I'm a lawyer. I'm here about the animals.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As you wish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be arguing your case with the city. I need to ask you some questions. (gets folder) I've done a little preliminary research -- precedent -- cases in the past that dealt with Santeria and Vou--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. This is not Santeria. We are not Voodoo. Candomble. Obeayisne. None of that. We are much older. Before. Before all of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.   Is there a name?   Or...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have papers. At your firm.      We have the tax exemption.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.  I'll get right into that. (scribbling away) The animals. Let's start with that, then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have an investment in blood. Think of it as spiritual currency.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moyez stands.    Starts slowly across the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, Mr. Moyez, I'm going to need your help with this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.   That's very clear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perhaps we could start at the beginning?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moyez, ignoring him, moves to an old refrigerator beside the stairs. For an instant, the door is open -- just a glimpse. Meat. Bags of entrails. Jars of blood. Moyez goes to a workbench near the wall --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Moyez?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is the name of the man who will prosecute us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (scanning file) Merto. Assistant District Attorney Arnold Merto.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bhalla.   La chemise noire.   Vite!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Boy already running up the stairs.       The sound of NAILS FALLING onto the workbench --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing, Mr. Moyez?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moyez stands aside, wiping his hands on his trousers. huge beef tongue sits on the bench. The nails are scattered around it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can go now. You will have all the help I can give you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moyez now with a hammer. And the nail. Driving it into the tongue. Kevin backing away, as we --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Video monitor -- FULL FRAME. DEVIL'S ADVOCATE - Rev. 11/2/96

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hand-held footage of a police raid. We're running -- through a building -- New York cops -- an animal control officer -- through a door -- voices yelling -- down some steps -- into a back yard -- people standing -- Here -- a scuffle starting -- voices rising -- the camera shaking -- we see Bhalla -- and the Woman -- and -- There -- in the middle, is a goat -- on its knees -- its throat has just been cut -- blood pouring into a pan and Moyez holding its head with one hand -- a knife in the other and this positively orgiastic expression on his face, and on that image, we freeze frame.

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED
dialogues.text: & 47

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: with the remote control.   Pam there with him.   A long, sour silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a health code case. And it's a loser. So what's the point? (watching her)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a test, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't everything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The smart thing to do is make a deal. Plea him out and suppress the tape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure the D.A.'s waiting for your call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, let him wait. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you can tell Milton too. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't come to New York to plea bargain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DEVIL'S ADVOCATE - Rev. 11/15/96

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jackie rejecting Mary Ann's color choices.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Law books stacked around.    An associate wheels in a trolley with more books.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary Ann eating fried chicken. She doesn't like the wallpaper. She's tearing it off, as we --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kevin working late.   Across the hall Pam is going home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's only a health code case.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bench trial. No jury. JUDGE THEO SKLAR and staff. A.D.A. MERTO at his seat. Pam sits with Moyez. Other than that, it's empty. A rump roast slaps down onto a table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a veal roast, Your Honor. U.S.D.A. approved and stamped. Eight days ago, in Kansas City, two men pushed a calf into a steel frame as a third man fired a high- voltage staple-gun into the animal's skull. Men kill animals and eat their flesh. Phillipe Moyez killed a goat. He killed a goat. And he did it at home, in a manner consistent with his religious beliefs. Now some people may find it bizarre.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DEVIL'S ADVOCATE - Rev. 11/15/96

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's certainly not a religious practice performed by everyone. It's not as common as, say, circumcision. It's certainly not as common as the belief that wine is transformed into blood. It's not even as common as the handling of poisonous snakes to prove one's faith. But Phillipe Moyez isn't two thousand miles away in a stockyard. He doesn't use electricity to kill. And worst of all... (holding up the roast) Phillipe Moyez is not shrink- wrapped.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Merto begins to cough.    Quietly at first, but...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your Honor, the city timed this police action to catch my client exercising his constitutionally- protected right to religious freedom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Merto's coughing getting worse as he tries to stop...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a law protecting Kosher butchering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly, Your Honor. And I'd like to move at this time for an immediate directed verdict for dismissal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moyez staring a hole in Merto, and the man cannot stop coughing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I happen to know a little bit about Kashrut law, Mr. Lomax.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DEVIL'S ADVOCATE - Rev. 11/2/96

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm aware of that, Your Honor, which is why I feel confident in requesting a dismissal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Merto?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Merto can't speak -- wheezing and coughing, as we --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Empty and dark. Kevin, Moyez and Pam leaving the courtroom. All smiles. Moyez shaking his hand and thanking him, and then, from behind them, the sound of one person CLAPPING --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (coming toward them) Bravo, Kevin. Bravo. (as he arrives) Pamela, you're looking lovely. (to Moyez) Satisfied, Phillipe?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Always.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kevin, what can I say? (smiles) Outstanding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kevin, trying to look modest and failing, as we --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A street-food stall. Milton paying for Kevin's eggroll. And they're walking...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Best street food in the world. Try that. Tell me it isn't great. (as Kevin eats) New York. What a scene, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DEVIL'S ADVOCATE - Rev. 11/2/96

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guy like Moyez living in that subterranean shithole all the time he's running around with fifteen million dollars in the bank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gotta be kidding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think? We're giving you away? He's paying us in goat's blood? I'm billing you out at four-hundred an hour, my friend. I don't see a whole lot of pro bono work in your immediate future. (buzzing here) Seriously, what I like, you got in there with him. Inside the cage. That's instinct. Can't be taught. You gotta hear that on your own. It's gotta be in your blood. It's molecular. I bet I've got five thousand lawyers working around the planet. I couldn't name ten -- couldn't name three -- I'd trust with Moyez.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what the hell are they doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are they doing? They're corporate lawyers, what do you think they're doing? They're busy reducing life and death to the proper position of a semi- colon. They're doing needlepoint. Push button battles. Push button wars. Armies that get so fucking far away from each other they need satellites to tell them who won. No pain. No sound. No smell. One big, multinational circle jerk. You, on the other hand, you're on the slaughterhouse floor. You can't help but smell your clients.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I figure you came to court to make sure I didn't fuck this up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DEVIL'S ADVOCATE - Rev. 11/2/96

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe I did. But don't get too cocky. No matter how good you are. Don't let them see you coming. That's the gaff, my friend -- make yourself small. Be the hick. The cripple. The nerd. The leper. The shit- kicking surfer. Look at me -- I've been underestimated from day one. Do I look like a master of the universe? That's your only weakness as far as I can tell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The look. The Florida stud thing. 'Scuse me, ma'am, did I leave my boots under your bed?'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never worked a jury didn't have a woman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what you're missing? What I have? This beautiful girl she's just fucked me every way she knows how -- we're done -- she's walking to the bathroom -- she turns back -- and there I am. It's me. And she smiles -- it's like a veil coming down across her face -- and that smile, that's a question mark, because she's looking at me, she's wondering, how did that happen? And see, right there, from that moment on, she's got a secret. I'm the hand up Mona Lisa's skirt. I'm the whisper in Nefertitti's ear. I'm a surprise. They never see me coming. That's what you're missing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Milton escaping across the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So why did you come down today?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DEVIL'S ADVOCATE - Rev. 11/2/96

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I knew it was gonna be good. Because I knew I was gonna like it. That you would shine -- that we would take this walk -- that we'd really talk. Why I came down? You want the truth? I'm an aging, hipster plutocrat. I came up from nothing. From dirt. I'm warming my hands on your talent -- (distracted then -- ) Where's the chicken?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A CHINESE MAN sits in a doorway --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (perfect Cantonese) Where's the chicken? The chicken that plays tic-tac-toe. He used to be right here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Cantonese) No, you passed it. Back that way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (back to Kevin, as they walk) There's a chicken, he's famous, he plays tic-tac-toe. He never loses. (suddenly) Hey. Like you. Right? (catching himself) Look, I'm rambling because I'm excited. You're in the part of the game I like best. The realm of the True Believers. You are a believer, aren't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I believe in the presumption of innocence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Better a hundred guilty men go free than a single innocent be executed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DEVIL'S ADVOCATE - Rev. 11/2/96

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Exactly like that. It's faith. You're either in or out. You can't believe a little bit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was kidding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not here to amuse me. See, that's why people hate lawyers. So many of us have lost our faith. Don't let that happen to you. Token?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Milton offering a token.       Behind him, the entrance t Canal Street station --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Learn the subways, Kevin. Use them. Stay in the trenches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kevin taking the token, as we --

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED
dialogues.text: & 55

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kevin just coming in from work. The apartment is starting to come together. Still not enough furniture, but the sparseness reads as elegance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (walking through) Mare... Mare...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from the bedroom) You're late...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DEVIL'S ADVOCATE - Rev. 11/2/96

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He stops. In the hallway -- a wall is missing -- sheetrock stacked on the floor -- tools piled around -- a renovation project halted for the night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's all this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary Ann up the hall in the bedroom door.      Finishing makeup for a night out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, that... (smiles) It was gonna be a nursery, but then I remembered you'd have to be home long enough to knock me up, so now I'm thinking of building a law library.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kevin smiles.    Drops his briefcase.     Drops his pants

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Save the thought. We were due up there fifteen minutes ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She blows him a kiss.    Ducking back into bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kevin and Mary Ann in their go-to-meeting clothes.      G up. Nervous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me I can handle this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can handle this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say something nice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something nice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Promise me you won't leave me alone in there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DEVIL'S ADVOCATE - Rev. 11/2/96                         4

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Promise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How the hell did we get here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Instinct.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door opens.    DIANA BARZOON, tonight's hostess, standing there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There you are! (to Kevin) Diana Barzoon, Eddie's wife. (an air kiss for Mary Ann) Come on, you two. Everyone can't wait to meet you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twice the size of Kevin's place. Decorated and furnished to the max. Seventy-five guests and ten in staff. The crowd is very smart, sleek, and experienced at these sort of things. Mary Ann's hand squeezing Kevin's just a bit more tightly as Diana leads them into the throng, and we begin --

dialogues.speaker: SERIES OF SHOTS
dialogues.text: Faces -- some of them strangers.    Some of them familiar from the conference room scene.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: huddled with Jackie and Mary Ann as Heath brings them drinks from the bar.

dialogues.speaker: PAM
dialogues.text: and two lawyers near the terrace doors -- the smoking section -- talking with nicotine-driven intensity.

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED
dialogues.text: DEVIL'S ADVOCATE - Rev. 11/2/96                       47.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTABELLA
dialogues.text: simply walking through the room.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE AND DIANA BARZOON
dialogues.text: They've found Kevin and Mary Ann.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love the eights. The entire 'A' line -- such a great shell. (manic and perhaps a bit insane)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do. I envy you. Starting from scratch. Do you have your fabrics yet? Tell me you don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not yet.   I don't think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come with me. Instantly. (to Kevin)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm borrowing your wife...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be gentle, honey. These are normal people. Mary Ann giving Kevin a "help me" look as she's dragged into the party --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your first?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this your first marriage?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (LATER)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Front door -- abuzz -- Milton has just arrived. DEVIL'S ADVOCATE - Rev. 11/2/96

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Across the room, Mary Ann with Jackie and Diana and another wife --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking over)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My God, girl...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You haven't met him yet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Milton -- across the room -- looks over -- he's found them -- already coming toward them -- smiling --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I swear he can hear us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell, he can smell us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary Ann? John Milton... (his hand and eyes)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was hoping we'd meet tonight. And here you are, already swimming with the sharks. Even as he says this, he's kissing their smiling cheeks. Mary Ann looking a little lost, as we --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kevin talking with another lawyer. Looking over as Christabella glides through the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Milton and Mary Ann sitting together.   Alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DEVIL'S ADVOCATE - Rev. 11/2/96

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deadbeats. I mean, that's what it comes down to. You can call yourself a finance trainee, or a financial resources adviser, or whatever, you're still spending most of your day trying to hammer car payments out of deadbeats. (looking around) No deadbeats here tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'd be surprised. There's a lot more fear in this room than you'd think.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do these people have to be afraid of?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Each other. Themselves.   Why? What scares you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not knowing who the deadbeats are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll figure that out. There's only one thing worth being frightened of anyway, and that's being alone. Truly and finally alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.   I think you're right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what terrifies me? Responsibility.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For what. For you. Let's be honest, I've changed your life. Changed it forever. There's been a seismic shift in your existence and I'm responsible. And you've never even met me. We're talking for the very first time. How insane is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DEVIL'S ADVOCATE - Rev. 11/2/96

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a wonderful opportunity for Kevin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kevin. Please. I'm not worried about Kevin. He buys a few new suits. Learns a few new tricks. He's there. I don't worry about Kevin. What about you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not leaving a lot behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must have family.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bad subject. I haven't spoken to my folks in a long time. My sister ran all the way to Germany.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoaa... I gotta think about that. I had you down as daddy's little girl, you know? The princess. Sugar plum snapshots. Pastel bedspreads. Cinnamon cookies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I tell Kevin the only thing worse than not having a father was having mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you've got a lot at stake here. You've made a real commitment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess I have.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not gonna be like Gainesville, but then you know that already.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're gonna be fine. It's gonna be great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DEVIL'S ADVOCATE - Rev. 11/2/96

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If it isn't, will you come to me? Let me help? I'd feel a lot less responsible. Will you do that for me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The worst vice is advice, right? But can I make a suggestion? It's about your hair, some people are sensitive, that's why I ask.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I mean, go ahead. You don't like it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have shoulders nobody can see. Pull it back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean, you want me to pull my hair back?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I do it, everyone in this room that's pretending not to watch us will assume we're fucking or something. Pull back your hair. (there's the mirror) Take a look. See. That's it. Isn't that incredible? You need to cut your hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're kidding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A woman's shoulders are the frontlines of her mystique. And her neck, if she's alive, has the very mystery of a border town. It's the no man's land in the battle between mind and body. (beat) You know, your natural color would really bring out your eyes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary Ann frozen there, as we --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DEVIL'S ADVOCATE - Rev. 11/2/96

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (MAGIC HOUR)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kevin standing at the rail.    He looks over.   Christabe not ten feet away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have this view?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From your terrace, is this your view?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sort of. Not exactly. I'm about twelve floors down. What about you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I live downtown. This is the family building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds like fun. Downtown, I mean. I'm just getting to know the city.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it everything you expected?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (raising her glass)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May we always have more than we expect. Salute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you alone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean, tonight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is your wife a jealous woman? (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silly question. We're all jealous, aren't we?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DEVIL'S ADVOCATE - Rev. 11/2/96

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughing) Oh, dear, I'm going to scare you away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I doubt it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You like to be on top, don't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of the situation. You prefer to be on top.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Depends on the view.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what I see?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Milton in the doorway.      He's been watching them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see the future of this law firm. (perfect Italian) Christabella, cara, prestamelo per favore, pe lo riporto piu tardi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a boring party, anyway. (to Kevin) Ciao.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kevin can't help watching her walk away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look,   we gotta talk. You grab Heath   and Eddie Barzoon and get up to   my place right away. And let's   be quiet about it.

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED
dialogues.text: thru 76 DEVIL'S ADVOCATE - Rev. 11/2/96

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Getting louder and wilder. Mary Ann looking lost. Searching for Kevin... He's not here... not there...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you seen Kevin? Jackie Heath shaking her head no, as Mary Ann continues on through the party.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence.   Going up.   Kevin, Heath, and Barzoon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary Ann still looking for Kevin. Scanning faces. Stopping as she reaches a door. Opening it and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just enough light to make out two MEN standing across the room. Silhouettes against the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry... (in doorway)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm looking for my husband. The Men -- two vaguely familiar faces from the firm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't think he's here. Suddenly, a WOMAN's head rises INTO FRAME --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just us...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But feel free to join in... And suddenly it's clear, she's walked in on an impromptu menage a trois. The Woman is kneeling on a table, dress hiked up, ass in the air. Man #1 fucking her from behind. Man #2 is getting blown and -- Mary Ann IN SHOT as the woman begins to laugh and the doo WIPES the FRAME. DEVIL'S ADVOCATE - Rev. 11/2/96                       55.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The penthouse. One enormous room. Grand scale everything. Otherworldly. Staggering. Of special, special interest: a huge Bas Relief dominates an entire wall. Carved into the marble are human forms -- young, naked bodies swimming in a hypnotic chaos of clouds. Milton is on the phone. Two lines going. The dialogue is unimportant, we'll not understand it anyway -- he's going back and forth between Korean and Russian -- brokering some emergency deal. Heath is at the bar, mixing drinks. Barzoon has a cigar. Kevin just standing there gaping at the space.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there more to it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just this room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And a bedroom?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where does he sleep?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who said he sleeps?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where does he fuck?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (behind them)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's up, John?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How many hours did we bill Alex Cullen last year?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sixteen thousand, two hundred and forty-two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DEVIL'S ADVOCATE - Rev. 11/2/96                       56.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck did he do now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex Cullen has just been charged with murdering his ex- wife, her stepson, and a maid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When did this happen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just now. Tonight. I already sent Pam downtown to make bail arrangements.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DEVIL'S ADVOCATE - Rev. 10/22/96

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They'll fucking crucify him. They'll get in line. I gotta call Meisel...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.    I want Kevin on this case.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope you're kidding. (beat) Alexander Cullen in a Manhattan triple murder? With Kevin? You're dreaming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've shaken hands with every marquee defense attorney in town. I take Kevin and I don't look back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a great judge of talent, John. You're the master. I just don't see it coming together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you on board, Eddie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I appreciate the vote of confidence, but maybe Eddie's got a point here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can get this case.   The man's our client.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a business client.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We know him better than he knows himself. We have the inside track. We have the best damn trial lawyer in the city. It's ours to lose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell it to Cullen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.    That's up to Kevin.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: With that, the PHONE starts RINGING --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's Pam calling... (to Kevin) Are we fighting for this, or not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's late. Dark. Kevin tiptoeing through the apartment -- turning the corner and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You left me there. I had a fucking panic attack until Jackie told me where you were. (raw) Three hours? You don't even call?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop. Reset. I'm upstairs, I'm with Milton and Barzoon and there is a very good possibility that I'm about to catch a triple homicide defendant who also happens to be the largest real estate developer in the city. I had to bail on the party!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You bailed on me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mare... did you hear me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was all by myself!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For three whole hours... (as she's walking) You gotta be kidding, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, she's leaving.    Kevin left there, alone --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DEVIL'S ADVOCATE - Rev. 11/2/96

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A news van whipping up the block. TIRES SCREECHING as it pulls up beside a construction site where two other news vans are already unloading. The smell of headlines and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
