dialogues.text: Two photographers sprinting toward the shell of a high- rise building. A sign blankets the scaffolding. Huge, ego-size lettering reads... CULLEN TOWERS "The Next Great Address"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking DOWN FROM fifty stories high, as the media vehicles converge like toys below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Look at this, I'm not out twenty minutes, we're running from the goddamn press. Look at those insects down there...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALEXANDER CULLEN turns back from the edge. Forty-five. Tan, grief-stricken, and sleep deprived. The space is huge and bare. Unfinished concrete. Wide, open views. Kevin, Milton, and Barzoon standing there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... You may be right, but look at it from my point of view. I'm sure he's a whiz kid. I believe you. But this is my ass we're talking. (to Barzoon)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, Eddie...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex, you know how this town works. You've got enemies you never heard of. And now? Now you're down? I'd prepare for a class-A, New York pig-fuck. You're going to have to ask yourself who you really trust. Who do you trust, Alex?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DEVIL'S ADVOCATE - Rev. 11/2/96

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know... I gotta look around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have time to shop, Mr. Cullen. (the newspaper) Jury selection started this morning at every breakfast table in the city. You lost round one. This is what people know. They know you and your wife were living separately. They see this maid -- Elucinda -- a sixty-eight-year-old grandmother supporting seven children. And then there's your stepson, a ten-year-old with a bullet in his brain. Those are already powerful images in the mind of the public.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't kill anybody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm telling you how it looks. You discover the crime. You call it in. You've got blood on your person and clothes, and -- (before Cullen can cut him off) -- and -- your prints are on the murder weapon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you know that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: Pamela and three other women smoking. Looking up, as Kevin comes flying out of the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caught me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've gotta find Cullen. (as he passes) We just got the prosecution discovery package.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That bad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kevin just keeps going into --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kevin needs a taxi -- bingo -- a cab -- dropping off right here -- he's got it -- opening the door and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Careful... (stepping out) You'll spoil me for other men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what they all say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DEVIL'S ADVOCATE - Rev. 11/15/96

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heard he finally dragged you out the other night... (as she walks) Can't believe I missed it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kevin watching her go, looking up, seeing the glass bridg high above.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A limousine double-parked outside a brownstone. Kevin standing there as Cullen comes storming out of the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I get one supervised hour a week with my stepdaughter. This is it. You better have a great reason to call me out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your wife, the day she was killed, had lunch with a friend. She says and I quote: 'Alex is fucking around and I can prove it.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hearsay.   Never gets in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wrong answer. (listen to me) Your prenuptial agreement is on file at the firm. The contract is null and void in the event of marital infidelity. (beat) You fuck around, she gets rich. (you asshole) That's a motive, Alex. (long pause) What do I need to know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Melissa. My assistant. (such a headache) She's not even that good a fuck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DEVIL'S ADVOCATE - Rev. 11/15/96

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And, on the night in question?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was boning my assistant while my wife was getting shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got to re-interview Melissa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget it.    We're not telling that story.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Juries want honesty.     Fuck with that at your peril.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cullen turns -- something more important --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Allesandra.   Wait...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Allesandra emerging from the building looking teary and distraught. Her THERAPIST helping her toward the limo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arthur...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time's up, Mr. Cullen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Allesandra.   Please...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kevin watching Cullen rush away, as we --

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED
dialogues.text: thru 151

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: New York time transition -- MOS.

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED
dialogues.text: thru 155 DEVIL'S ADVOCATE - Rev. 11/15/96                        8

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Towncar pulls up. Mary Ann, Kevin and Mrs. Lomax emerge. Just back from dinner. Two steps and -- A PAPARAZZI photographer nearby --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kevin, hey, how's it going? Can we get a couple shots here? How about a thumbs-up here? What do you say? Kevin reluctantly smiles.   Get it over with.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's he doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kevin's had his picture in the paper. FEENEY, the doorman, at the ready. Mary Ann first inside. Mrs. Lomax lingers a moment watching Kevin have his picture taken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome to Babylon, Ma.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, Mr. Lomax, I thought we'd scared 'em all away...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Always did like to stick his nose in a camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as they enter)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And how are you, Mrs. Lomax?   Did you have a fine dinner?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I surely did. (she's got a doggie bag)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you hungry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I'm fine.    Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Speak of the devil...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DEVIL'S ADVOCATE - Rev. 11/15/96

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: There he is, waiting for the elevator. With him are Christabella and an Asian woman who is so sexy it hurts. Kevin off balance from this moment on. Mary Ann smells the danger.       Everything is awkward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was just telling the Moyez story.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And is this your mother?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.   Mom, this is...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John Milton.    Nice to meet you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice Lomax.    How do you do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary Ann... (a kiss for her) I think you've met Christabella, and this is Giselle who's just in from Paris.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A moment of bullshit superficial greetings and then -- the elevator doors opening and the whole uncomfortable clot of them moving into --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just enough room.       They ascend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for the champagne.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've very welcome. (to Mrs. Lomax) This isn't really your first visit to New York, is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a moment) Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DEVIL'S ADVOCATE - Rev. 11/2/96

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cette femme, elle est la mere de l'homme dont vous m'avez parle?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She can't believe you're his mother. You've done one helluva job bringing him up, Mrs. Lomax. I'm sure it wasn't easy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Lomax has been staring, and now Milton meets her eyes as the elevator stops and the doors open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice to see you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have a lovely evening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kevin next out, holding the door, waiting --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom, we're here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.   Good night to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Lomax takes one last look at Milton as she exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kevin, hang on... (holding the door) How's Cullen. Everything on beam?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a long conversation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the b.g., Mary Ann opening the apartment door and going inside. Mrs. Lomax right behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hush hush) Why don't you come on up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Milton smiles.      Christabella smiles.   Giselle smiles

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's talk tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DEVIL'S ADVOCATE - Rev. 11/2/96

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Milton shrugs. Your loss. Christabella has her hand on Giselle's ass, working up her skirt --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kevin left standing there as the doors close.

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED
dialogues.text: thru 161

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Lomax, subdued, listening to Kevin and Mary Ann bickering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That what you're doing when you're working late?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are we talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know exactly what I'm talking about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's ridiculous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to bed. (walking off) 'Night, Alice...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary Ann exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DEVIL'S ADVOCATE - Rev. 11/15/96

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm worried about her. You shouldn't fight like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not a fight, Ma, it's marriage. Not exactly your area of expertise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you happy here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you happy here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're kidding, right? Am I happy? Every now and then I look around and I think my mama must be praying awful hard for me, 'cause I died and went to heaven. Am I happy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were always running somewhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess I finally got there. (sensing something wrong) Look, I'm sorry about being so busy this week. Maybe Saturday I can get some time off and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry on it. (touching his face) I love you more than anything in the whole world. You know that, don't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you too, Ma.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kevin turning out the lights, as we --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Newspapers.    Laying on the doorstep.    Headline reads:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DEVIL'S ADVOCATE - Rev. 11/15/96

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kevin, dressed for work, briefcase in hand, rushing down a cup of coffee, reading the headline and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door to the guest room is open.      He looks in --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Lomax fully dressed.      The bed is made.    Her ba packed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom?    Ma, what are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going home, Kevin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?   What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't feel right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just got here. (his watch) Look, I'm late and I just got my teeth kicked in on the front page, so I gotta run. We'll talk later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to go, Kevin. I miss my church.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ma, this is New York, there must be twenty-thousand goddamn churches. Take your pick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need to do a better job with Mary Ann. She's not well. This place isn't good for her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DEVIL'S ADVOCATE - Rev. 11/15/96

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So stay. Take care of her if you're so concerned! Help me out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll take her home if you let me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is home. You understand? This is where we live! I'm not going back to Gainesville. Unbelievable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Wide is the gate, and broad is the way that leadeth to temptation.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a little early for scripture. I'm going to work. (as he walks) You can do whatever you want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Lomax watching him go, as we --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Melissa and Kevin on a bench. Kids playing. One of them is hers, but she's not paying much attention at the moment --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't do it. It's one thing to have an affair with your boss, it's another to have to tell the world in a murder case.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have to bring it out, Melissa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My ex-husband would have a field day with this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A man's life is at stake.   You're our whole case.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Melissa looking away, as we --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DEVIL'S ADVOCATE - Rev. 11/15/96                       92

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Modern. Empty. The JUDGE is a WOMAN. No bullshit. Barzoon sitting alone at the defense table. Federal prosecutor MITCHELL WEAVER on his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... there is nothing vague or exploratory about this subpoena request, Your Honor. We're specifically asking for any and all documents relating to Devada Holdings. It's taken six months and seventeen separate motions and we still don't know who's responsible here. We've got a paper trail here that seems to stretch into eternity!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Barzoon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't turn over what you don't have, Your Honor. We've been conducting a comprehensive search of our records and I'm sorry to say it's a great deal less than Mr. Weaver would suggest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your Honor, this is outrageous. We need to get in there and seize these documents before there's nothing left!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your Honor, it's exactly these types of insulting accusations --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enough. Both of you. Put it on paper. I'll read it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your Honor...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DEVIL'S ADVOCATE - Rev. 10/22/96

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: But the gavel comes down. Done.      Barzoon packing up, looks to the back of the room. Kevin sitting there.    Waiting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Busy.   Lots of traffic.   Barzoon and Kevin walking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget about lunch. This guy Weaver is running me ragged.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A REPORTER pulls up alongside -- excited --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kevin. Nancy Osborne, Metro News. How are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Busy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We had a report of a private plane at Teterboro airport ready to take Alexander Cullen out of the coun --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cutting her off) Mr. Cullen is innocent. He's not going anywhere. He's been released on a two million dollar bond. He looks forward to having his day in court. Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kevin, is there any truth to --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm in the middle of a meeting. Call my office. Schedule an interview. Or else forget it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barzoon is getting away.    Kevin hustling to catch up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm picking a jury tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're good at that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DEVIL'S ADVOCATE - Rev. 10/22/96

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not gonna have time to help me on Cullen, are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just then, Weaver comes rumbling past --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Devada Holdings, Eddie. Look in your rearview window, I'm right behind you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before he can answer -- ANOTHER REPORTER swoops in --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kevin, Chuck Higgery, Action News. Have you spoken with Alex Cullen concerning the D.A.'s report...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kevin turns to see two more REPORTERS jogging over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kevin, just a statement --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And a photographer -- Kevin under siege and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (backing away) Gotta go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barzoon escaping as reporters begin to materialize from all sides, and we --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dark. Quiet. Mary Ann in her chair. She looks like hell. Eyes red from crying. Kevin has just come home and found her like this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I dreamt about this. (beat) Right here. (beat) It's not a dream if it's true.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me this is the medication.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You won't stay with me now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, let's get you undressed and in the tub. Okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You won't stay. I know you. You'll leave me now for sure. (as he moves to comfort her -- ) Get-away-from-me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.  I'm confused. (furious) Why? What is it now? What the fuck is it today, Mare? I swear to God, I'm calling this doctor, I'm gonna find out what the hell they're giving you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They took my ovaries. I told you! (tears now) My sisters have seven children between them. My mother had Derek when she was forty-five. You could set a clock by my periods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't have children!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Says who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doctor! The other doctor.   I was there today. (beat) Non-specific ovarian failure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's ridiculous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The PHONE begins to RING across the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grabbing his arm) I know you. You'll leave me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DEVIL'S ADVOCATE - Rev. 11/2/96

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary Ann...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's these monsters, Kevin. (losing it) I dreamt this...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The PHONE keeps RINGING. Kevin will finally pull away. Answering the phone O.S., quietly conducting business as Mary Ann falls apart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kevin on a cell phone walking with Milton.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh huh. For sleep. And she can take that during the day? (beat) No, she won't be driving. (beat) I'm gonna have the pharmacy call you right back. Thanks. (hangs up, sags against the car) He thinks, he's not sure, he thinks it could be some kind of hormonal imbalance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm taking you off the case.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you to drop this case.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This case? Cullen? (incredulous) John, I've got a jury showing up this morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you love this woman?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.    Of course I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DEVIL'S ADVOCATE - Rev. 10/22/96

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kevin, she's sick. Everyone will understand. I'll understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stunned) What about Cullen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll find someone new. You consult. You live to fight another day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I put together a great jury.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a disappointment. We all have them. Embrace it. Use it. You move on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hang on, we gotta talk about this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's to talk? It's your wife, man. And she's very sick.    And that's gotta come first. (beat) Are you telling me the possibility of leaving the case has never crossed your mind?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what scares me? I quit the case. She gets better. And I hate her for it. (silence) I don't want to resent her, John. I've got a winner here. I gotta nail this fucker down, do it fast, and put it behind me. Just get it done. Then put all my energy into her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess you have thought about it. I stand corrected.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DEVIL'S ADVOCATE - Rev. 11/15/96

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Packed. JUDGE ARMAND POE presiding. Cullen seated with Kevin and Pam. The jury in their box. And prosecutor FRAN BROYGO on his feet, just wrapping up his opening statemen

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... And when all that evidence is laid before you, when all these pieces weave together, you will conclude -- you will know -- that Alexander Cullen is guilty of murdering three people in cold blood with malice aforethought. Done.   The courtroom is silent.   The jury liked him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Lomax... (checking his watch)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can break for lunch now, or you can do a stop and start...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If it's a choice, I'll go now. I won't be as long as Mr. Broygo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Proceed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We just spent our morning listening to Mr. Broygo talk about his 'evidence'. What he neglected to tell you is what this case is really about. He left out the most important fact of all: Alex Cullen was somewhere else when these murders took place. Now, Alex Cullen has done a lot of things I don't like. He's been a terrible husband to all three of his wives. He's been a destructive force in the lives of his step-children. He's cheated the city. His partners. His employees. He's paid hundreds of thousands of dollars in penalties and fines over the years. I don't like those things. I don't expect you to like them. There will be other things during the course of this trial that you will hear about and like even less. But this isn't a popularity contest. It's a murder trial and Alex Cullen hasn't killed anybody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DEVIL'S ADVOCATE - Rev. 11/15/96

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The state is going all out here. They've got a whole team over there. They're throwing everything but the kitchen sink at this case. I need one thing from you. That's it. One thing. I need you to ask yourself, 'Is not liking this man reason enough to convict him of murder?' (beat) Enjoy your lunch. We'll talk again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stunned silence, and then --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kevin thrown back against a wall --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck was that? Are you out of your fucking mind? (murderous) They fucking hate me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kevin -- one push -- Cullen sent flying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen to me like you've never listened to anybody before. I'm going to bust my ass to make sure they hate you. Because as long as you're out boning Melissa, you're not home killing your wife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pause, as he warms to the idea) Why didn't you tell me before?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then it doesn't look spontaneous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DEVIL'S ADVOCATE - Rev. 11/2/96

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Forensic TECHNICIAN on the stand.     A display chart beside him. Blowups of the bloody hand-prints.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me put it this way, then: can you tell from a blood sample if the person were alive or dead?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The victim?   Of course not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And there's a two hour window in which to place these murders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, you've got absolutely no way to determine the condition of the victims when Alexander Cullen put his hand on that wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kevin into the evening air, carrying a bag of stuff. Barzoon standing there in a jogging suit. Furious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saw you go in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cold)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Congratulations.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DEVIL'S ADVOCATE - Rev. 11/2/96

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not over yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not talking about the trial.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How the fuck does your name get on the firm's charter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like it's been there for years. Now you're a partner? When did that happen? I am still the managing director of this firm. You want my job? Take me head on. Backdoor me one more time and I'll take your partnership papers and stuff 'em down your throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what you're talking about, but I sure as hell don't like your tone of voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bullshit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got a problem with documents, I suggest you put together one of your late-night shredding sessions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think you're tough enough to run this firm? Fine. (backing away) You tell Milton next time Weaver calls maybe I pick up the phone.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Kevin standing there, watching him jog away, as we --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kevin sitting there with his bag of groceries.      Milto looking sadly perplexed --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was he drunk?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I doubt it. He was going running. What the hell was he talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie's gotten himself into trouble again. And he wants me to save him. And I can't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why does he think I'm after his job?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have any experience with manic-depression?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not directly, no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You do now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Milton already on the phone.       Punching a number.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, it's me. (beat) Get Eddie Barzoon. Right away. He may be out running, so page him if you have to. It's an emergency. (hangs up, turns back to Kevin) Looks like you could use a drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary Ann coming through the living room. She looks stoned. But moving with purpose. As if she were hearing something. Opening the terrace doors and staring out over the park, as we --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The reservoir entrance. It's a nice night and busy with runners and bikes and -- Barzoon comes jogging past.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kevin has a vodka in his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie Barzoon. (wearily)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've nursed him through two divorces, a cocaine rehab, and a pregnant receptionist. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God's creature, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No leaves on the trees. Barzoon running. Breaking a sweat now. Leaving the heavy traffic behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll tell you, Kevin, because I know you're into theology. When you've seen -- when you've represented -- when you've dealt with as many people as I have over the years, finally you say to yourself, 'God must've been awfully bored.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DEVIL'S ADVOCATE - Rev. 11/2/96

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat) Choice. The opportunity to fuck up. Talk about entertainment value.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barzoon running.    Into his pace. Glancing down and on the horsepath below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three running shadows. Side-by-side.     Just passing beneath an iron bridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You take a look at Eddie Barzoon you gotta wonder if maybe God overplayed his hand. Maybe he made the game a little too interesting...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barzoon turns back -- stumbles -- catches himself -- sprinting now to the Pump House. He pulls up here. Resting as several other runners pass by. Glancing back, almost an afterthought and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those three running shadows are now crossing the bridge which is completely impossible considering where they just were a moment ago and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barzoon starts running again -- instinctively -- faster than before -- glancing back and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (EFX) The three shadows. The sun setting behind them. Transforming as they run -- animal shapes mixing with the harsh silhouettes of bare trees and -- DEVIL'S ADVOCATE - Rev. 11/2/96

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barzoon freaked -- What the fuck was that? -- The park suddenly looking very empty -- and dark --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The three shadows and they're closer and weirder and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barzoon -- suddenly turning -- changing course -- leaving the path -- into the woods -- quickly ducking down beside a huge sycamore tree. Hiding. Sweating. Scared. Staring back out at the path --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three women runners -- clear as day -- pass beneath a streetlight. Team clothes. Machine-like strides. Flat- out. And then gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barzoon stands from behind the sycamore tree. Relief. Smiling at his own stupidity. What a jerk. Dusting off. Heading back toward the path, when --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, there's an arm around his neck -- throwing him to the ground --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Standing there above him, a crazed-looking homeless MAN -- he's white and old and hungry --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gimme your watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (standing now)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want the watch, old man?   Come and get it. DEVIL'S ADVOCATE - Rev. 11/2/96                         1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barzoon moving toward the old guy when -- Crack! -- A tree branch swings out of nowhere -- catching his elbow -- snapping it back and -- A second homeless man. He's black and older than the first guy but just as wild and dangerous and he's winding up to swing the branch again and -- Barzoon on his knees -- dazed -- blood pouring from his head -- uncomprehending eyes watching these park creatures tear at his clothes --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (EFX) Watching them grow more feral and less human by the moment and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary Ann staring out at the park. Covering her ears against some horrible sound that she alone can hear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barzoon -- on his belly -- in the dirt -- trying to move -- crawl -- anything --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two men beating Barzoon to death with stones --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- transforming with every blow -- (EFX) as their hands descend they become terrifying, demonic creatures, and as they rise we see them as men and over and over, as we hear --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DEVIL'S ADVOCATE - Rev. 11/2/96

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You take a look at Eddie Barzoon you gotta wonder if maybe God overplayed his hand. Maybe he made the game a little too interesting. Milton turns to find Kevin staring at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna, I'm gonna go downstairs now. Put this stuff away. (backing away with his bag of groceries)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ice cream's already melting. Milton watching him walk away, as we --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pam exits the room. Melissa sitting at the head of the table. Kevin pacing around her. They are alone. Practicing her testimony over early morning coffee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You testified that the defendant called you at four-thirty to ask you to come to his office gym for the purposes of sex.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Cullen, though, he's not just your lover, is he? He's the boss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So two hours go by before you act on his request?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I went up at six-ten. I knew it was six-ten, they had weather coming on the news. I remember --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cut off by --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.  Stop. (breaking character) This prosecutor is no fool. He's gonna change tempo, attitude, tone of voice -- he's gonna come out with questions you never thought of, just to screw you up. (coaching) So what do we do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes and no answers. Stay calm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly. (back into it) Is it your testimony, Ms. Block, that between the hours of six-ten and nine-forty you were engaged in sexual congress with the defendant?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At any point during this three hour marathon, Ms. Block, did you lose sight of the defendant?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did he use the bathroom?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is he circumcised? (silence) You understand the question?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So is he cut or not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence.   Melissa looks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've been polishing his knob three times a week for six months and you don't know whether or not he's got foreskin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (total transformation) I've had it up to here with this fucking game. Why don't you take your questions and shove 'em up your ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kevin staring at her.       Looking away.   Moving quickl the door, and into:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three steps out and he stops. Something's wrong. Very wrong. People are out of their offices, standing in the doorways. Some of them crying. Christabella rushes toward him, into his arms --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Kevin --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie Barzoon...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's dead.   He was killed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DEVIL'S ADVOCATE - Rev. 11/2/96

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Heath nearby has more answers --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Last night in the park. He was running if you can believe it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kevin standing there, holding Christabella. Feeling heat on the back of his neck and turning to find Milton at the far end of the hall. Their eyes lock --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is wrong with people?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At least they got the scumbags who did it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turning on this) Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two old, homeless crazies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pam coming through the hallway like steel --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kevin... Kevin, I'm sorry, but you're due in court in thirty minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Melissa appears in the conference room door --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are we through here, or what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll bring Melissa down in the car, but you better get going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SCREAMING uptown. Kevin looking very rattled.      Milton beside him. Talking him down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you to put Eddie aside. Let me worry about it. You gotta deal with Cullen now. Marshal your strength. Prioritize. Conserve your energy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DEVIL'S ADVOCATE - Rev. 11/2/96

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't put her on the stand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What choice do we have?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know she's lying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because she didn't answer you fast enough? Did she lie to you? No. She said nothing. The fact is, you'll never know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He killed those people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You really believe that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cullen set me up. Melissa, the whole thing, I know it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, you gotta go with your gut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's your advice?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll back you either way. Hey, you think I haven't lost before? (pause) We talked about this, Kevin. Pressure. Take a big whiff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kevin unreadable.    The SUBWAY CAR RATTLING away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Packed and ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Lomax, you may call your next witness.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: A long, awful pause. Kevin in agony. Milton behind him. Cullen and Pamela and everyone waiting...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Counselor...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I call Melissa Block.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chaos! -- media madness -- Kevin pushing past dozens of reporters and camera crews -- court officers trying to clear the way -- fifteen voices screaming at once -- questions flying like shrapnel -- Cullen, all smiles, alongside Milton as they're pushed along -- Pam, waving a cell phone, fighting her way to Kevin and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kevin! (re the phone) Kevin, it's for you --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kevin takes the phone, trying to hear above the noise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A cab speeds to a stop. Kevin jumps out. Feeney, the doorman, standing there with Felix, his partner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She didn't look well, sir. Felix tried to talk to her, but she --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is she?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kevin running down the sidewalk and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kevin enters. It's empty and dark. Two old ladies up front. Mary Ann in back, wrapped in a comforter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey... (sitting beside her)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mare. It's me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He let himself in. You need to know that. The bath running, or something, I didn't hear him. I swear to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then we talked. We talked for hours. (coming apart for good)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I haven't talked to anyone, really talked to anyone in such a long time. You have this whole life and all I have is me and he was so clear about it all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who let himself in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I came down here. I've just been sitting. I'm afraid to pray. I let him stay. I'm sorry. I'm sorry. I'm sorry, Kevin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did somebody hurt you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Milton. He fucked me, Kevin. I let him fuck me. I couldn't stop him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?     When?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Today. This afternoon. All afternoon. God, I'm so ashamed...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DEVIL'S ADVOCATE - Rev. 11/2/96

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Today? Today? Today. He was in court, Mare. He was in court, in my presence all afternoon!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sobbing) I'm not crazy. I'm not.   I swear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, Mare. I don't know how much more of this I can take.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stands. Throws open the comforter. She is naked. There are scratch marks all over her body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kevin with a NURSE and paperwork.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sign there... And there... And one more... (as he's done) She's calm now so this might be a good time to say good night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kevin nods.    Stands, moving now -- into --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary Ann on a moving gurney. Calm now, in the sway of some very strong drugs. Kevin kneels beside her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know why this is happening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They want you to go to sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the money, Kevin. Blood money. We just drank it down. Both of us. We knew it. Winning those cases, taking the money. We knew they were guilty. But you kept winning. Every time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DEVIL'S ADVOCATE - Rev. 11/2/96

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (fading) I can't look at myself in the mirror, Kevin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A big one. A funereal morning.      Hearse and cortege parked on the street outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barzoon's funeral. Big deal. Big crowd. An excess of flowers. ORGAN MUSIC as foreplay. Milton, up front, seating Diana and children. Kevin seated on the aisle.     Beside him, Jack Heath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do they say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They don't know. It's bad.   She's falling apart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have room for one more?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kevin turns to see Christabella standing beside him. Jackie's concerned expression blossoms into a private, knowing smile now that Kevin has turned away. Christabella squeezes in, as the MUSIC SWELLS and THE PRIEST walks solemnly to the altar. Kevin caught in a high-intensity sexual cross-fire between Jackie and Christabella. He's tense. He's flipping out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Milton passes on his way to the back.     Smiles. DEVIL'S ADVOCATE - Rev. 11/2/96

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On one side the Therapist, on the other Allesandra, excep she looks different than last we saw her. Hair down. Makeup.   She could be all of seventeen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are here today, to remember and pray and exalt in the spirit of Edward Barzoon... Kevin staring at Cullen and the girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Father, husband, partner, friend, colleague...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (EFX) Cullen's hand stroking at the back of the pew -- nothing outrageous, except it does call to mind the hand of Mr. Gettys back in Florida --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... taken from us so suddenly... Cullen's hand moving with purpose -- stopping -- waiting -- as Allesandra sits back and now his fingers find her skin -- stroking ever so subtly --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... to contemplate evil. How it robs -- how it steals everything of value from us... Cullen turns -- except it's not Cullen, it's Gettys -- yes, Gettys -- whispering in Allesandra's ear and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... farther from God's purpose...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kevin out of his seat. Pushing past Christabella -- rushing up the aisle --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... and the greater that distance, the greater evil's pleasure...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Milton watching Kevin flee the church.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moments later.   Kevin hustling away --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (behind him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Lomax?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No comment. I'll have something for you later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a friend of Eddie Barzoon. Kevin turns.   Weaver walking beside him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember me? Mitch Weaver. Justice Department.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Staking out the funeral?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking for you actually.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm in a bit of a hurry right now. I need to talk to my wife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just wanted to ask you -- off the record -- I had a few questions about Eddie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The funeral. In progress. CHOIR and ORGAN getting LOUDER. We're watching Milton move in the back of the church.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kevin walking faster.    Weaver right beside him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Milton, Chadwick, Waters is a little more than a law firm, but then I assume you knew that. (working him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Devada Holdings? I'm sure you've heard of it. London, Kinshasa, Karachi -- Arms brokering mostly. You've got Munzer-Dietch, they're in Berlin and Djakarta -- chemical weapons, toxic waste. Ivanaco Limited -- Moscow -- money laundering for the Eastern Bloc. (at his ear)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It goes on and on, Kevin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stained glass.   Angels.    The Stations of the Cross.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Milton standing in the shadows at the back.      Taking i all in. Prodigal angel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (EFX) And then, the stained-glass angels begin to move. Wings begin to beat. Expressions come alive. Expressions of panic and fear and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kevin really striding.     Weaver right there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Milton is into everything. (listen to me)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barzoon was coming in, Kevin.     He was gonna testify.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Desoto and Dibalista, in Panama, that's a firm that specializes in opening bank accounts for judges all over South America. Huge drug cases. Murder. Everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a lawyer! What the fuck do you want? (stopping there) Stay off my back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Weaver left standing there, as Kevin rushes away -- through traffic -- across the street --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a first time, last time offer! (calling after him) I'm learning about you, Kevin. I talked to some old friends down in Florida this morning... (louder now) The Gettys case. The eighth grade teacher? (did Kevin just slow down) Found him this morning. He had the body of a ten-year-old girl in the trunk of his car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kevin, across the street, stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (EFX) Stained-glass angels going nuts now -- wings flapping like mad -- danger everywhere, as the MUSIC STARTS to CLIMAX and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Milton down below. Lowering a single finger into the holy water. Instantly -- it's boiling, and we --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DEVIL'S ADVOCATE - Rev. 1/18/97

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kevin standing there, across the street -- Weaver smiles, thinking he'll talk now for sure -- stepping off the curb and -- TIRES SCREECHING and Weaver turning and -- A car trying to stop and -- Kevin watching as -- WHAMM! -- Weaver ploughed onto the hood and -- A mother at the wheel -- her daughter beside her -- both screaming and -- The car's WINDSHIELD as it CRUMPLES and -- Kevin watching as the car stops and -- Weaver is dazed but alive -- his face buried in the windshield -- pulling himself up and -- Weaver's face THROUGH the shattered glass as he looks down to see -- Mother and child (EFX) -- transforming -- for an instant -- into monsters and -- Weaver more terrified than hurt -- scrambling off the hoo of the car -- staring back in horror and -- Mother and child -- completely freaked out -- both of the hysterical and -- Weaver holding his arm -- nose bloodied -- but moving -- backing away -- turning to find Kevin still across the street and -- It's gonna be okay. And then, a big flat-nose truck -- out of nowhere -- air BRAKES BLASTING as it just wipes Weaver OFF the SCREEN and -- Kevin falling back, flat against a wall -- STAYING ON Kevin -- as the street comes alive with the SOUNDS of EMERGENCY and he starts moving away and we --

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED
dialogues.text: & 225 DEVIL'S ADVOCATE - Rev. 1/18/97

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kevin walking through -- stopping finally at an open door --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary Ann in a chair. Heavily sedated. Pam standing beside her, brushing her hair. Mrs. Lomax, on her knees, standing now --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kevin... honey...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I came this morning. I been calling the house and getting no answer and then I spoke to Pam and... I need to talk to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got her on the first flight up this morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just... I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you excuse us a moment? Mrs. Lomax guides Kevin out.   Mary Ann's vacant eyes watching them exit --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just outside the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never should've left. I knew it. I'll never forgive myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was gonna call you, I just...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DEVIL'S ADVOCATE - Rev. 1/18/97

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What I did, Kevin, I thought it was for the best. Loving you was always first for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's nothing you could've done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could've told you the truth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've lied to you, Kevin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Always. (pause) Baptist Endeavor Youth Crusade, ninety-sixty-four. I was here. In New York. That night in the elevator, you never let me answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We stayed a week. The Tremont Hotel, it's not there anymore, I went by and it's gone -- they had a restaurant downstairs and we ate there almost every meal --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait.   Stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your father was a waiter in that restaurant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, this is great, Ma... this is just perfect --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- honey, listen to me --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DEVIL'S ADVOCATE - Rev. 1/18/97

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (total incredulity) -- Now? You do this now? -- Because, I mean, your timing -- it's superb -- you wait thirty years? -- you fly up here -- you pick today? --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Kevin, honey, wait --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- obviously I'm not under enough pressure -- I don't have enough on my mind, I need this little --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you doing this now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I'm afraid!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kevin overwhelmed -- walking away -- down the hall -- completely fritzed -- leaving her standing there --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kevin.  Kevin! (calling after him) 'Behold I send you out as sheep amidst the wolves.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kevin just stopped walking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary Ann quiet as Pam finishes brushing her hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you look beautiful now. (re something in her bag) Here. Have a look and see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hand mirror.      Mary Ann turns away instantly --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DEVIL'S ADVOCATE - Rev. 1/18/97

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all right, dear.        Look...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.   Please...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go on. Take a look.      See how beautiful you are?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary Ann opens her eyes. There's her reflection. She is beautiful. It's okay. She smiles. What was she afraid of? And then, the mirror shifts to find --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pam -- A monster (EFX) -- her features horribly transformed in the glass and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary Ann rears back -- her head smashing into Pam's face so hard that the MIRROR SHATTERS -- Pam, blind for a moment, staggering back -- Mary Ann on her feet and fighting and Pam suddenly pushed and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pam standing there, holding her face in pain, as the glas door slams shut and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary Ann THROUGH the glass, jamming a chair up under the doorknob --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kevin!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kevin jogging down the hall -- trying the door --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DEVIL'S ADVOCATE - Rev. 1/18/97

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (it won't open) Mary Ann. Hey. Hey! (still no luck) Omigod... Get somebody!   Go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pam doesn't move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary Ann, kneeling on the floor, picking up a broken shard of mirror and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mare! -- Look at me! -- Stop! -- right now -- Mare! --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary Ann raising the glass/blade to her throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (through the glass) Mary Ann, no! No! No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Help! -- Help! -- Somebody!   We need help --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DEVIL'S ADVOCATE - Rev. 1/18/97

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kevin banging like mad on the glass but --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Mare! -- No! -- Look at me! -- Mary Ann raising the blade to her throat and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Stop! -- No! -- Mare! -- Kevin grabbing a folding chair -- swinging it --

dialogues.speaker: 241A OMITTED
dialogues.text: thru 243

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SMASH! -- GLASS SHATTERING over the floor, but Kevin stil can't get in -- wire mesh embedded in the window is bent but unbroken and he's tearing at it and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Mare! -- Hang on! -- I'm almost there! -- Look at me! And she does.   Watching him claw at the wire --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I loved you. Pulling the blade across her neck --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Noooooooooo!

dialogues.speaker: 243B OMITTED
dialogues.text: thru

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kevin kicking full force against the door and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DEVIL'S ADVOCATE - Rev. 1/18/97

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door buckles -- the chair wedged in there sent flying -- Kevin stumbling over broken glass --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, God, Mare, what've you done? -- no... Mary Ann falling to the floor -- her bloody hand still holding the blade deep in her neck --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- why? -- Oh God, Mare, why? (over his shoulder)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need a doctor in here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patients out of their rooms -- standing at their doorways sedated, bovine expressions watching --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (running through)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- please -- somebody -- help her! -- What are you all doing? Somebody! -- ORDERLY #1 turning the corner up ahead --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the hell's going on down here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kevin cradling Mary Ann -- his hand trying to staunch the wound in her neck -- blood flowing -- she isn't moving -- her eyes are starting to fix and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- no, Mare -- hang on -- please, Mare, I'm right here, it's gonna be okay, baby -- oh, God, Mare, why did you do this? -- (screaming now)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's the fucking doctor?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh shit, man...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DEVIL'S ADVOCATE - Rev. 1/18/97

dialogues.speaker: 244C CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Kevin turns -- Orderly #1 in the doorway --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing? Help her!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, look, I ain't no doctor... (backing away) Hang on -- lemme --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YELLING in the hall now, and faces in the doorway. Mrs. Lomax crying and two weird patients from the next staring and... Pam.   And only we can see it, but she's smiling...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- please, baby, stay with me... it'll be okay -- it's gonna be fine just, just stay with me -- Oh God, Mare... please, baby...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kevin holding her, but she's gone, as we --

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED
dialogues.text: thru 246

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But someplace completely different. Older.        Dark. Echoey. A fluorescent bulb sputtering out. FOOTSTEPS approaching... It's Kevin. And we know instantly that Mary Ann is dead. There's blood on his shirt. His eyes are raw. At his side, a small suitcase containing her personal effects. More than grief, more than shock, what we notice most is his frighteningly grim determination. Up ahead, a bench. Mrs. Lomax huddled here. Cried out. Empty. Holding herself more tightly as he sets down the suitcase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could've packed that up for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kevin sits.    If he loses his steel he'll drown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DEVIL'S ADVOCATE - Rev. 1/18/97

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish you'da let me help you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finish the story. (off silence) Nineteen-sixty-four. You're in New York. There's a waiter in a restaurant. (waiting) Finish the story.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He talked to me. Nobody'd ever really talked to me before. Sixteen years old, a thousand miles away from home, somebody takes an interest... Working so hard, putting himself through school, I'd never met anybody like that. Knew the Bible, every word, just knew it by heart. Every meal, there he was, at my ear and I just... I didn't want that week to ever end. But it did. He came to say goodbye, it was late, and I started to cry and he said not to worry, 'Behold, I send you out as sheep amidst the wolves.' And that just stopped me cold because we'd spent that whole day at Bible study reading Matthew Ten and there was just no way for him to know about that, so I was... I took it as a sign. I let him in. And then everything was different. He was cruel. He was so cruel and I was so ashamed, I thought I'd die...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kevin's eyes settle on the suitcase.      Mary Ann...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I promised right there if God would let me back into His grace I would never leave again. I prayed there was a reason this terrible thing had happened. There had to be a reason. And there was. It was you. You were my blessing. You were reason enough to endure anything. How much I love you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to hear you say it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DEVIL'S ADVOCATE - Rev. 1/18/97

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His face -- that night -- I knew it was him and the same time I was confused -- and you were so proud you'd come to New York and done all this on your own, I didn't have the heart to tell you --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (desperate to finish) -- you wondered yourself -- the apartment, the money, all this attention, everything out of nowhere... (pause) Milton. He's your father. (there it is, out loud) Somehow he found us. Tracked you down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's always been there. I know that now. Watching. Waiting. He's been playing us like a game. Jerking us around. Destroying Mary Ann...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kevin stands.      Quiet fury.   A machine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... let it alone! Stay with me. (panicked) Forget about him! We can leave here. We can go home! We don't ever have to see him again!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DEVIL'S ADVOCATE - Rev. 1/18/97

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't do that. You go home. (backing away) Pray for Mary Ann.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kevin, please... Honey! (calling after him) I love you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kevin disappearing down the stairs. Mrs. Lomax dropping to her knees as his FOOTSTEPS ECHO away, and we --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Kevin explodes through a fire door.   Pam standing there, having a smoke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There you are... (all smiles) Look at you... you're terrified. Not to worry. He'll take that fear away. You don't ever have to be frightened again. Go on, he's waiting...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kevin turning and something is very wrong --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fifty-seventh Street is empty. No cars. No people. Just the building and the silence. Turning back and Pam is gone, and then -- And then a WIDER ANGLE -- it goes on and on... He's alone Just now realizing the scale of Milton's power. Starting to walk, as we --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room's only light coming from the huge bas relief. Kevin steps off the elevator, into the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DEVIL'S ADVOCATE - Rev. 1/18/97

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right about one thing... I have been watching. Couldn't help myself. Watching, waiting, holding my breath. But I'm no puppeteer, Kevin...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Milton appears out of nowhere.       Walking past Kevin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... I don't make things happen. Doesn't work like that. Free will -- it's like butterfly wings -- one touch and it never gets off the ground. I only set the stage. You pull your own strings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kevin has a gun -- Cullen's gun, in his hand --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you do to Mary Ann?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A gun?   In here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you do to my wife?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On a scale of one to ten, ten being the most depraved acts of sexual theater, one being an average Friday night run-through at the Lomax household, I'd say... (beat) Six.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kevin FIRES the GUN -- BANG! BANG! BANG! -- bullets pass right through him -- into the wall --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa... Got me! Damn! (laughing) That's my boy. Step on up! Stay angry! Keep hold to that great fury! Hang on tight, Kevin, because it's the final fig leaf.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kevin lowers the gun to his side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DEVIL'S ADVOCATE - Rev. 1/18/97

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never lost a case. Why? Why? Because you're so fucking good? Yes. But why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because you're my father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I'm a little more than that. Awful hot in that courtroom, wasn't it? 'What's the game plan, Kevin?' (reporter's voice) 'It was a nice run, Kevin. Had to close out someday.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have so many names.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Satan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call me Dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary Ann, Barzoon, Weaver...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on. You're not listening. Blaming me for Mary Ann? I hope you're kidding. You could've saved her any time you liked. She only wanted love. But you knew it wouldn't really work out, didn't you? Mary Ann in New York? Face it, you started looking to better- deal her the minute you got here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a lie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, it's not that you didn't care for her, it's just you were a little bit more involved with someone else. Yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell do you know about love?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DEVIL'S ADVOCATE - Rev. 1/18/97                      135.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bio-chemically no different than eating large quantities of chocolate. (sharply now) Don't be such a fucking chump. There's only one real sickness in all of creation and that is self- delusion. I told you to take care of your wife -- that the world would understand. And you made a choice. 'You know what scares me, John? I leave the case, she gets better and I hate her for it...' Remember?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You set me up.     It's entrapment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who told you to pull out the stops for Mr. Gettys? And Moyez -- the direction you took -- Snake handlers, Popes and swamis all feeding at the same trough -- whose ideas were those? And then Cullen -- knowing he's guilty -- seeing those pictures -- putting that lying bitch on the stand... What did I say, Kevin? Maybe it was time to lose, right? You didn't think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's my job.     That's what I do!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly! (gotcha) Vanity is definitely my favorite sin. Self love. It's so basic. What a drug. Cheap, all-natural, and right at your fingertips. Pride. That's where you're strongest. And believe me, I understand. Work for someone else? -- Hey, I couldn't hack it. 'Better to reign in Hell than serve in Heaven.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want from me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do I want? I want you to be yourself!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DEVIL'S ADVOCATE - Rev. 1/18/97                         1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (EFX) The Bas Relief -- that wall of bodies swirling in marble clouds -- it's going to come to life --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've had many children, Kevin. So many disappointments. Neurotic, indecisive wannabes. Over-eager, ham-handed butchers. Strung-out, priapic losers. And then there's you. Your mother, I'll tell you, she outstripped my wildest fantasy. That church she dragged you to? Every day? What training. What a challenge! It's awesome what you've done. How far you've come. Both of you... You and your sister. Christabella emerges from behind the bar --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Half-sister to be exact.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Surprise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think, Kevin?    What a scene, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (passing Kevin)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't let him scare you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait till you meet her mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is a test, isn't it? The whole game, you sitting there, keeping score.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. That's the other guy. I don't judge anybody. As far as I'm concerned, everyone's a winner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DEVIL'S ADVOCATE - Rev. 1/18/97

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God's your prankster, my boy. Think of it. He gives man instincts. He gives you this extraordinary gift and then, I swear to you -- for his own amusement -- his own private, cosmic gag reel -- he sets the rules in opposition. It's the goof of all time. Look but don't touch. Touch but don't taste. Taste but don't swallow. And while you're jumping from one foot to the other he's laughing his sick fucking ass off! He's a tight-ass. He's a sadist. He's an absentee landlord! (incredulous) Worship that? Never.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (EFX) The Bas Relief getting stranger and more seductive by the moment -- bodies spinning and spawning --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm here, on the ground, my nose in it since the whole damn thing began. Why? Because I worship man himself. And it's my time now. Our time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anybody want a drink? I'm having a drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is some pitch. You must need me pretty bad. What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie was right. Your name is on the partnership charter. I want you to take over the firm. You and your sister.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DEVIL'S ADVOCATE - Rev. 1/18/97

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. (letting his hand brush her cheek) She's ovulating. Right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your vanity is justified, Kevin, you're the seed to a new future. Your son will sit at the head of all tables. You hold a special place in the history of all things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want a child.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want a family.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Antichrist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I have to volunteer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christabella begins to strip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Free will. It's a bitch. (beat) I need a family. I command an ever larger presence on the board. I'm busy and I need some help. There's a plan here. I've been conserving my energy. Synergy. Prioritize. It's the millennium, Kevin. Title fight. Round twenty. I'm ready to work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what are you offering?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are we negotiating?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Always.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DEVIL'S ADVOCATE - Rev. 1/18/97

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you offering?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything. Anything. All of it! (he's got him) What am I offering? I'm offering bliss. Instant bliss. Bliss by remote control. Bliss on tap. That first line of cocaine. That walk into a strange girl's bedroom. The jury coming back in thirty- eight minutes. Freedom. Revolution! Viva la causa!

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED
dialogues.text: thru 259

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (EFX) The Bas Relief transforming into real clouds and bodies and the frame of it disappearing and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right, aren't you? About me. I mean, I made all the choices, didn't I? Gettys. Cullen. Mary Ann. I did kill her, didn't I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be too hard on yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christabella passing Kevin, handing him her bra.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's done.    Forget it. It's all for us now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God, she's just fucking stunning, isn't she?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christabella lingering and Kevin leaning in... kissing her... just a moment before she pulls away --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DEVIL'S ADVOCATE - Rev. 1/18/97                        14

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right. I wanted to fuck her from the minute we met.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like that's wrong. Like there's anything wrong with that. That there could be laws preventing something so natural. That's our ticket in. (excited now) Did you know there were more students in law school right now than lawyers walking the Earth?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (EFX) The Bas Relief has become an orgy, bodies coming to life in a swirling, narcotic haze and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're coming out, guns blazing. The two of you -- all of us -- acquittal after acquittal until the stench of it reaches so high into heaven it chokes the whole fucking lot of them! What we cannot legislate we will buy. What we cannot buy we will degrade. We will blow every fuse of enlightenment until it looks like a vandalized, neon sign! And while God is busy at his peephole -- as he deigns us with his disapproval -- as he lumbers around his empty kingdom like some overfed colonial governor -- as God sleeps late, we will win. We've got a winner here, kids!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the Bible you lose.   You're destined to lose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Consider the source.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christabella -- her hands -- moving over her body --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop talking. Both of you. (reaching out) Kevin, please...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
